item.title: Stéfan Sinclair on "Cost Analysis for Commercial Web Hosting in Academic Context"
item.dc:creator: Stéfan Sinclair
item.description: Thanks Peter. I take it from the quietness of this thread that – as we both thought – there's not much out there at this point.

item.title: Peter Leonard on "Cost Analysis for Commercial Web Hosting in Academic Context"
item.dc:creator: Peter Leonard
item.description:
About the only recent (2009, published 2010) thing I know of is this:

Dynamic Space for Rent: Using Commercial Web Hosting to Develop a Web 2.0 Intranet

... which is more of a particular narrative than anything larger-scale...

item.title: Stéfan Sinclair on "Cost Analysis for Commercial Web Hosting in Academic Context"
item.dc:creator: Stéfan Sinclair
item.description: Can anyone point me to any good, recent publications that compare the costs of setting up and maintaining server infrastructure vs. the cost of commercial hosting? I realize that there are a ton of variables underlying the question, but I suspect someone's done some relevant case studies. I'm imagining CIO-oriented reports that are specific to the academic context. I'm pretty sure that it would be cheaper and more reliable to use a commercial host in many cases, but I'd like to provide more substantial data.
